alert.note: Alert for Brown; Cherry; Keya Paha (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 12 at 9:53PM CDT until October 13 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT /1015 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Nebraska, including the following counties, Brown, Cherry and Keya Paha. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM CDT /1015 PM MDT/. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 953 PM CDT /853 PM MDT/, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ainsworth, Johnstown, Antelope Peak, Bobcat State Wildlife Management Area, North River Trail, Meadville and Keller Park State Recreation Area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
